Policy: Decree No. 8.892 creating the National Commission for the Sustainable Development Objectives.
Policy_Content: This Decree, consisting of 14 articles, creates  the National Commission for the Sustainable Development Objectives with the purpose of internalizing, diffusing and giving transparency to the implementation process of the Agenda 2030 for Sustainable Development of the United Nations, endorsed by the Federate Republic of Brazil. It establishes composition, duties and responsibilities of the above mentioned National Commission, as an advisory collegiate body, under the Secretariat of the Presidency of the Republic. This National Commission for the Sustainable Development Objectives is responsible for the following sectors: elaborate an action plan for the implementation of Agenda 2030; propose strategies, instruments, actions and programmes for the implementation of the Sustainable Development Objectives (ODS); monitor the development of ODS and prepare periodic reports; organize subsidies for discussions on sustainable development in national and international fora; identify, systematize and disseminate good practices and initiatives that contribute to the achievement of ODS; and promote the articulation with public organs and entities of the Federate units for the dissemination and implementation of the ODS at the state, district and municipal levels.

Policy: Law No. 3.925 establishing forestry compensatory measures for mining activities carried out in the Legal Reserves.
Policy_Content: This Law establishes forestry compensatory measures for mining activities carried out in the Legal Reserves. The State Environmental Agency may only authorize the extraction of mineral substances in the Legal Reserve area through a previous Environmental Licensing Process. It specifies that every mining activity depending on the suppression of vegetation in the Legal Reserve area for the extraction of mineral substances shall, before issuing the respective authorization of the State Environmental Organ for suppression of vegetation, adopt the following forestry compensatory measures: implementation of Private Reserve of Natural Heritage (RPPN); donation of area to the State of Rondônia for the implementation of a new Reserve; Conservation of the Integral Protection Group; and/or institution of perpetual environmental servitude. The area to be offered for forestry compensation shall: have a 20% greater dimension than the green area belonging to the Legal Reserve to be suppressed by the mining activity; be located in the same area of ​​the Legal Reserve to be compensated; and be located in the territory of the State of Rondônia.

Policy: Agricultural Holdings (Units of Production) (England) Order 2016 (S.I. No. 1002 of 2016).
Policy_Content: This Order prescribes units of production for the assessment of the productive capacity of agricultural land situated in England. An assessment of the productive capacity of agricultural land is required in determining whether or not the land in question is a "commercial unit of agricultural land" for the purposes of the succession provisions in the Agricultural Holdings Act 1986. The Order includes net annual income figures for land which is an eligible hectare for the purposes of Council Regulation (EC) No 73/2009. The Order also prescribes net annual income and specifies particular farming use for assessment purposes. Land includes land in a less favoured area and moorland. Prescribed units of production include: livestock, farm arable crops, outdoor horticultural crops and fruit and moorland.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 799 validating the Regulation on state natural zoological reserve “Red forest”.
Policy_Content: State natural zoological reserve “Red Forest” is protected area of regional significance formed for unlimited period of time without expropriation of land from tenants, owners and managers. The scope of creating the reserve for conservation, restoration and reproduction of wild fauna species and their habitat, primarily hunting resources, as well as rare and endangered wildlife species listed in the Red Book of the Russian Federation and the regional Red Book. The reserve was created to perform the following tasks: (a) conservation and reproduction of wild fauna species; (b) conservation of the habitat of wild fauna species, as a necessary condition for their existence and reproduction; (c) conservation of valuable natural complexes and natural objects located on the territory of the reserve; (d) maintaining the necessary ecological balance and stability of the functioning of ecosystems; and (e) creation of favorable conditions for the habitation of protected animal species. The following activities shall be prohibited on the territory of state natural zoological reserve “Red forest”: (a) all types of hunting; (b) stay with firearms and hunting gear; (c) collection of eggs except for scientific research purposes; (d) destruction or damage to nests, hollows, burrows and other habitats and shelters of wild fauna species; (e) introduction of alien wild flora and fauna species; (f) implementation of aviation pest control measures, except for cases related to the need to implement measures using biological control methods; (g) farming, organization of pastures and grazing of farm animals; (h) use of fertilizers and pesticides; (I) exploration of subsoil, mining and blasting operations; (j) burning of vegetation; (k) destruction or damage of barriers, notices, stands and other information signs and indications related to the functioning of the reserve; (l) organization of waste disposal sites; (m) littering of the territory; (n) effluent waste water discharge; (o) re-profiling of economic and production activities of land users that were developed by the time the reserve was organized; and (p) placement of advertising and information boards on the land plots of the reserve, not related to the functioning of the reserve.

Policy: Wind Energy Sea Act.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act is to expand the use of wind energy at sea, particularly in the interest of climate and environmental protection. In order to take better account of fundamental energy policy objectives such as environmental impact, supply security and cost efficiency, the new EEG introduces a competitive auction system for renewable energy. Such transition is in line with the European Commission’s environmental protection and energy subsidies guidelines, which stipulate that, as of 2017, subsidies have to be awarded in an auction system in order to ensure the subsidies system is admissible as state aid.A transitional regime applies to offshore wind installations commissioned between 2021 and 2025 before the present Act’s new “central” auctioning concept is fully implemented. The new system will fully apply to plants commissioned from 2026 onwards. In addition to the introduction of the auction system, the Act also sets out the relevant statutory provisions for the planning and permission process of offshore wind farms. Therefore, the Act will replace the respective provisions of the EEG, the Offshore Installations Ordinance (Seeanlagenverordnung; “SeeAnlV”) and the Energy Industry Act (Energiewirtschaftsgesetz; “EnWG”) for the most part. The present Act includes provisions regarding area planning in the German Exclusive Economic Zone (“EEZ”) and coastal waters (Küstenmeer), regarding preliminary investigations and suitability tests of potential project sites – which will no longer be performed by future wind farm operators, but by governmental authorities under the new “central” system – and regarding plan approval procedures (Planfeststellungsverfahren).The text consists of 79 articles divided into 6 Parts as follows: General provisions (1); Planning and preliminary investigation (2); Tenders (3); Approval, erection and operation of wind turbines at sea, and installations for the transmission of electricity (4); Special provisions for pilot wind energy installations at sea (5); Other provisions (6).

Policy: Governor’s Decree No. 175-ug validating the Regulation on protection zone of nature monument of regional significance "Lake Zaborye".
Policy_Content: The scope of creation of protection zone of nature monument of regional significance "Lake Zaborye" shall be prevention of adverse anthropogenic effects thereon. Economic and other activities causing damages to natural complexes and wild fauna and wild flora species shall be prohibited, in particular: (a) performance of works that violate the hydrogeological regime of the lake, lead to the emergence and development of soil erosion processes; (b) soil pollution, littering of the territory, organization of landfills (including snow dumps) and dumping of domestic and non-domestic waste; (c) placement of high hazard risk industrial enterprises in accordance with sanitary classification; (d) placement of cemeteries, cattle burial grounds; (e) exploration and mining; (f) washing of vehicles; and (g) disturbance of habitats of rare and endangered plant species, mushrooms and wild fauna species recorded in the federal and in the regional Red Books. The following activities shall be authorized: (a) forest management in accordance with acting federal legislation; (b) recreation of the population, walks; (c) collection of plants and mushrooms, except for protected, endangered and rare species recorded in federal and regional Red Books; (d) hunting in accordance with hunting permits; (e) recreational physical education; (f) organization of camps and tourist stations; (g) conducting study tours, classes, seminars; and (h) authorized uses of urban land.

Policy: Order No. 528 of the Ministry of Natural Resources and Ecology validating the Regulation on the national park “Sebezhsky”.
Policy_Content: This Regulation establishes that the location of the national park “Sebezhsky” shall be Pskov region of the Russian Federation. National park “Sebezhsky” shall perform the following tasks: (a) conservation of natural complexes, unique and reference natural sites and objects; (b) conservation of historical and cultural heritage; (c) environmental education of the population; (d) promotion of regulated tourism and recreation; (e) development and introduction of scientific methods of nature protection and environmental education; (f) implementation of state environmental monitoring; and (g) restoration of disturbed natural and historical-cultural complexes and objects. On the territory of the national park, shall be prohibited any activity that can damage natural complexes and objects of flora and fauna, cultural and historical objects and which contradicts the purposes and tasks of the national park, including: (a) exploration and mining; (b) disturbance of the soil cover and geological outcrops; (c) activities entailing changes in the hydrological regime; (d) allotment of land parcels for horticulture and smallholding; (e) construction of main roads, pipelines, power transmission lines and other communications, as well as construction and operation of economic and residential facilities, except for tourism industry facilities, museums and information centers, facilities related to the functioning of the national park and the functioning of settlement located within its boundaries; (f) logging, including water logging, (except for timber extraction by citizens for individual personal needs); (g) procurement of soft resin; (h) commercial, sport and artisanal hunting, industrial fisheries; (i) procurement of edible non-timber forest resources (with the exception of procurement by citizens of such resources for their own personal needs); (j) disturbance of natural habitats of wild fauna and wild flora species; (k) biological collections, except for research purposes, envisaged by thematic and research plans of the Institution; (l) introduction of living organisms in order to acclimatize them; (m) passage and grazing of domestic animals outside authorized areas; (n) organization of mass sports and entertainment events, organization of tourist camps and making bonfires outside the specially designated places for such purpose; (o) unauthorized conduct of archaeological excavations, collection and removal of objects of historical and cultural value; (p) stay with firearms, pneumatic and throwing weapons, including hunting firearms and hunting gear; (q) unauthorized blasting operations; (r) burning of vegetation (with the exception of fire-fighting measures implemented in coordination with the Institution); (s) clear cutting of forest species and shrubbery, with the exception of sanitary felling, felling associated with extinguishing forest fires, including the creation of fire breaks, and felling associated with the construction, reconstruction and operation of line facilities carried out in accordance with this Regulations; (t) waste disposal of domestic and non-domestic waste, radioactive waste, chemical, explosive, toxic, poisonous and hazardous substances; (u) washing vehicles on the banks of waterbodies; movement and parking of motorized vehicles outside public roads and specially designated places, navigation of vessels outside authorized waterways; (v) destruction and damage of posts, barriers, stands, boundary poles and other information signs, developed ecological paths and recreation areas, buildings on the territory of the national park, as well as property of the Institution, inscriptions and signs on boulders, outcrops and historical and cultural objects; (w) application of chemicals, mineral fertilizers, plant protection means and nutrients; and  (x) flight of aircraft less than 500 meters above the territory of the national park without coordination with the Institution.
Subject: Forestry, Wild species & ecosystems

Policy: Order No. 50n of the Federal Agency of Scientific Institutions of the Russian Federation validating the Regulation on Far Eastern Marine Biosphere State Nature Reserve.
Policy_Content: This Order establishes that protected area Far Eastern Marine Biosphere State Nature Reserve shall make part of the international biosphere reserve system of UNESCO. The reserve is located in the southwestern part of the Peter the Great Bay (the Sea of Japan) and occupies about 10% of its area. It shall perform the following tasks: (a) the protection of natural areas in order to conserve biological diversity and maintain in a natural state protected natural complexes and objects; (b) the organization and performance of scientific research, including keeping and updating of the Annals of Nature; (c) performance of state environmental monitoring; (d) environmental education and development of cognitive tourism; and (e) assistance in the training of scientific personnel and specialists in the field of environmental protection. On the territory of the reserve, any activity shall be prohibited any activity that contradicts the objectives of the state nature reserve and the regime for its special protection, including: (a) landing and staying on islands, islets, kekurs (conical rocks on a seacoast) and cordons of protection of external persons, not employed by the institution; (b) movement and parking of vessels, including small and sailing, watercraft in the area of the reserve without special permission from the administration; (c) movement and parking of vehicles not connected with the functioning of the reserve, outside roads and outside specially designated places; (d) commercial, artisanal and sport hunting; (e) commercial fisheries; (f) stay with firearms, pneumatic and throwing weapons, and hunting gear; (d) exploration of minerals and mining; (g) soil disturbance; (h) activities that entail changes in the hydrological regime of land; (i) procurement of soft resin; (j) clear cutting of forests; (k) timber extraction and harvesting of non-timber products; (l) transit passage and grazing of cattle; (m) plowing of land, with the exception of measures for forest firefighting; (n) haymaking, except for ensuring fire safety; (o) explosive works; (p) burning of vegetation and grassland fires, except for case of extinguishing forest fires; (q) water logging; (r) introduction of alien species; (s) transit and stay of motor vehicles; (t) stay with dogs, except for service dogs; (u) flight of aircraft and helicopters below 2000 meters above the territory of the reserve; (v) disturbance and feeding of wild fauna species by the visitors; and (w) all kinds of photo and video filming (including amateur) without the prior permission of the administration of the reserve.

Policy: National Multisectoral Nutrition Action Plan (NMNAP) 2016 - 2021.
Policy_Content: This National Multisectoral Nutrition Action Plan (NMNAP) is a 5-year document implementing the 2016 National Food and Nutrition Policy (FNP) in addition to being  its 10-year Implementation Strategy, up to 2025/26. It broadly aims to accelerate scaling up of high impact multi-sectoral nutrition specific and nutrition sensitive interventions and creating an enabling environment for improved nutrition, so that children, adolescents, women and men in Tanzania are better nourished leading to healthier and more productive lives that contribute to economic growth and sustainable development. The NMNAP is evidence-informed, results-oriented, and consistent with the theory of change and based on the three ONES principle at all levels: one plan, one coordinating mechanism, and one monitoring and evaluation framework. To achieve that goal, has identified the following seven key results areas (i) scaling-up maternal, infant, young child and adolescent nutrition; (ii) scaling up prevention and control of micro-nutrient deficiencies; (iii) scaling up integrated management of acute malnutrition; (iv) scaling up prevention and management of diet related non-communicable diseases; (v) integration of multi-sectoral nutrition sensitive interventions; (vi) improving nutrition governance; and (vii) establishing a multi-sectoral nutrition information system. It is important to specify that the term malnutrition is used to refer to both under-nutrition and over-nutrition (mainly overweight and obesity, which lead to the development of diet related non-communicable diseases), and the NMNAP is a so-called “double duty action” plan that integrates actions to combat simultaneously the two issues into one plan.

Policy: Loi n° 2016-028 du 11 octobre 2016 portant code de la marine marchande.
Policy_Content: La présente loi qui a trait au code de la marine marchande comprend 539 articles repartis en 8 livres déclinés en titres, chapitres et sections. Cette loi est applicable à toutes les activités se déroulant dans les eaux maritimes, les lagunes, fleuves et plans d'eau dans les ports, et concerne tous les navires immatriculés sous pavillon togolais, aux équipages et passagers qui y sont embarques, ainsi qu'à toutes les personnes, quelle que soit leur nationalité, présentes ou non à bord. Par ailleurs, ce code s'applique aux équipages, passagers et navires étrangers se trouvant dans les eaux sous juridiction togolaise en application des conventions internationales en vigueur. Les dispositions du présent code s'appliquent également aux manquements résultant des activités maritimes, fluviales, lagunaires constates dans les eaux sous juridiction nationale. Le Titre II du livre I fixe l’organisation de l'administration maritime dont les missions sont: administration des navires, engins flottants, iles artificielles, ouvrages de mer et de lagunes, épaves et hypothèques maritimes; participation à l’administration des plates-formes de forage et de production pétrolière et gazière et autres engins à caractère minier et pétrolier en ce qui concerne les activités maritimes et lagunaires; participation à l’administration des domaines publics maritimes, lagunaires et fluviaux; administration des professions maritimes et des gens de mer; participation à la protection et à la préservation des milieux marins, lagunaires et fluviaux; participation à l’application de la règlementation du travail maritime; règlement des conflits individuels ou collectifs; sécurité et sûreté portuaires; sécurité et sûreté de la navigation; participation à la recherche, à l’assistance et au sauvetage en mer, en lagune et dans les parties navigables des fleuves; participation au contrôle et à la surveillance des pêches maritimes et fluvio-lagunaires. Ce texte met en place l’Organisme National chargé de l'Action de l'Etat en Mer (ONAEM).  Le Titre III du livre I définit la navigation maritime, notamment la classification des types de navigation; les zones de navigation (notamment la zone relative à la navigation de pêche: la petite pêche; la pêche côtière; la pêche au large; la grande pêche); la navigation réservée; les phares et balises; la police de la navigation; les formalités d'arrivée et de départ des navires dans les ports auprès de la capitainerie (ici, tout navire d'un pays tiers ayant à bord des produits de pêche, fait parvenir à l'autorité de la pêche, au moins trois (03) jours ouvrables avant l'heure estimée d'arrivée dans les ports togolais, les pièces suivantes: le ou les certificats de captures ou, s'il y a lieu, l'autorisation de transborder des produits de la pêche; la ou les autorisations de pêche et le journal de pêche au cas où c'est un navire de pêche. Les informations visées ci-dessus sont également communiquées à la préfecture maritime); espaces maritimes sous juridiction nationale (domaine public maritime et portuaire: la délimitation la composition, la gestion domaine public maritime; eaux sous juridiction nationale: eaux territoriales, zone contiguë, zone économique exclusive, plateau continental); et les domaines publics lagunaires.

Policy: Plan Nacional para la Gestión del Riesgo de Desastres y Adaptación al Cambio Climático en el sector Agrícola del Paraguay 2016-2022.
Policy_Content: El presente Plan es un instrumento de alcance nacional, relativo al período 2016-2022, cuyo objetivo general es reducir la vulnerabilidad del sector agropecuario frente a los riesgos de desastres exacerbados por la variabilidad climática y el cambio climático, a través del fortalecimiento de la institucionalización de la gestión del riesgo en el sector, el mejoramiento de los mecanismos de información y monitoreo del riesgo agroclimático, la implementación de acciones de prevención y mitigación del riesgo y la preparación para una respuesta eficaz. Constituyen objetivos específicos del Plan: 1) reducir las condiciones de riesgo a través de la transversalización de la gestión del riesgo y la coordinación inter-sectorial horizontal y vertical; 2) mejorar la evaluación y comunicación del riesgo para la toma de decisiones de gestión del riesgo y la adaptación al cambio climático, a nivel central y descentralizado; 3) desarrollar y aplicar instrumentos para la reducción del riesgo y adaptación al cambio climático, a favor de los medios de vida de los productores y productoras más vulnerables; 4) fortalecer los mecanismos de preparación ante desastres a través de la acción y respuesta temprana con el fin de reducir pérdidas en la producción y medios de vida, considerando las necesidades prácticas y prioridades estratégicas de productores y productoras. Los principios rectores del Plan incluyen el de sostenibilidad, equidad, responsabilidad (el causante de un daño a la sociedad o al ambiente deberá reparar los perjuicios y restaurar las condiciones afectadas) y acción permanente (las amenazas y los eventos adversos, ya sean naturales o generados por el ser humano, exigen respuestas precisas rápidas y constantes, además de organizadas y coordinadas, lo que obliga a mantener un estado permanente de alerta, así como la aplicación constante de los conocimientos científicos y tecnológicos para la reducción del riesgo de desastres).

Policy: Cabinet Regulation No. 669 of 2016 on Procedures for Concluding and Supervising a Voluntary Agreement on Energy Efficiency Improvement
Policy_Content: The Regulation prescribes the conditions for the conclusion of a voluntary agreement on energy efficiency improvement; the content of the agreement; the duration of the agreement; and the supervision of the implementation of the agreement. Under the agreement, the party to the agreement shall undertake to achieve energy saving amounting to at least 10 %. Achievement of the energy savings target shall be based on the energy efficiency plan of the party to the agreement. An obligated party of the energy efficiency obligation scheme may not be involved in the achievement of the energy savings target specified under the agreement. Achievement of the target shall be confirmed by the energy efficiency measures and energy savings announced in the State energy efficiency monitoring system.

Policy: Agriculture and Natural Resources Sector Growth and Transformation Plan II (ANR GTP II).
Policy_Content: The present Agriculture and Natural Resources Sector Growth and Transformation Plan follows The First Growth and Transformation Plan and it is born from lessons drawn from its implementation. The ANR GTP II is a nationwide sectoral document aiming at contributing towards the national target of achieving Middle-Income economy by bringing about a broad-based, rapid and sustainable sectoral development that ensures befits to all citizens with due emphases to women and youth, which are the general development goals of the Growth and Transformation Plan (GTP) of the country. The agriculture sector objective is to realize fast and sustainable growth and ensure the citizens benefited from the growth. This shall be achieved through the following three main specific objectives (i) sustainable and climate resilient green growth, bringing transformation within the sector and to the economy as a whole; (ii) participation of women, youth and other actors, guaranteeing that they benefit to the level of their contribution; and (iii) building production capacity and macro-economic stabilization. Policy: Ley Nº 27.279 - Presupuestos mínimos de protección ambiental para la gestión de los envases vacíos de fitosanitarios. Alcance y definiciones.
Policy_Content: La presente ley establece los presupuestos mínimos de protección ambiental para la gestión de los envases vacíos de fitosanitarios, en virtud de la toxicidad del producto que contuvieron, requiriendo una gestión diferenciada y condicionada. Los objetivos de estas disposiciones incluyen: a) garantizar que la gestión integral de los envases vacíos sea efectuada de un modo que no afecte a la salud de las personas ni al ambiente; b) asegurar que el material recuperado de los envases que hayan contenido fitosanitarios no sea empleado en usos que puedan implicar riesgos para la salud humana o animal, o tener efectos negativos sobre el ambiente; c) mejorar la eficacia de la gestión, considerando las estructuras y métodos preexistentes en cada jurisdicción, de conformidad con el principio de progresividad; d) dinamizar el procedimiento administrativo para el registro y autorización de los sujetos comprendidos en la presente ley; e) establecer y definir las diferentes etapas y eslabones comprendidos en la gestión integral de los envases vacíos de fitosanitarios. La Ley contempla  todos los envases vacíos de fitosanitarios utilizados en el territorio nacional, los que deberán ingresar a un Sistema de Gestión Integral de Envases Vacíos de Fitosanitarios.

Policy: Resolution No. 460 of 2016 of Georgian Government on Rules of Assessment of Risk of Use of Alive Genetically Modified Organism in Closed System
Policy_Content: The Resolution regulates assessment of hazards associated with using GMOs in a closed environment. The document provides for two levels of risk: risk level 1(A,B) and risk level 2 (A,B). The risk is assessed by the person using the GMOs before an application for the license of GMOs use is filed with the state. The Resolution provides for criteria which need to be used when assessing the risk level. It also requires the persons using the GMOs to periodically update the risk levels according to the new circumstances. In its annexes, the Resolution also provides for preventive measures required for each risk level; safety measures for laboratory work; safety requirements for greenhouses and plant cultivation rooms; safety requirements for work in animal units; and safety requirements for other activities.

Policy: National Spatial Plan 2015-2045.
Policy_Content: The Ministry of Lands and Physical Planning is charged with the responsibility of formulating general principles of land planning. In this respect, the Department of Physical Planning of the Ministry has prepared the National Spatial Plan (NSP) which sets out policies and strategies to guide the spatial development of the country. The National Spatial Plan details out the national vision that will guide the long term spatial development of the country for a period of 30 years. It covers the entire territory of Kenya and defines the general trend and direction of spatial development for the country. It aims at achieving an organized, integrated, sustainable and balanced development of the country by providing a framework for better national organization and linkages between different activities within the national space.

Policy: Presidential Decree No. 1066 on the establishment of the National Coordination Council for Sustainable Development of the Republic of Azerbaijan.
Policy_Content: By this Decree, the President decides to establish the National Coordination Council for Sustainable Development. The Council shall be composed of 14 members and the Deputy Prime Minister shall chair the Council. The main goal of the National Coordination Council for Sustainable Development is to determine the national priorities and related indicators that are of importance for Azerbaijan by 2030 in line with global goals and targets, to ensure that state programs and strategies covering socio – economic fields in the country are aligned with Sustainable Development Goals, and to prepare an annual report with regard to achievement of the Sustainable Development Goals. The Council shall be authorized to involve local and foreign experts, specialists, international organizations and scientific institutions, as well as working groups for individual fields in order to perform its functions. As per these obligations, there were specified an obligation to establish office of the secretary for the Council and to submit information to Ministry of Economy regarding performance of its functions, and statistic information on indicators of achievement of Sustainable Development goals to State Statistics Committee, and to the Council as a report. Ministry of Finance shall be authorized to finance the costs from performance of the functions of the office of secretary for the Coordination Council based on the proposals made by Ministry of Economy of the Republic of Azerbaijan, and Central and local executive authorities, as well as legal entities whose control share belongs to government shall be authorized to submit information and documents necessary in the activities of the Council.

Policy: Regulation of the Ministry of Environment and Forestry of R.I. No. P.81/MENLHK/SETJEN/KUM.1/10/2016 on Cooperation of Use of Forest Zones for Supporting Food Security.
Policy_Content: This Regulation, consisting of 19 articles divided into four Chapters, regulates the Cooperation of Use of Forest Zones for Supporting Food Security. Purpose and objectives of this Regulation are: promoting cooperation in the use of forest areas to support food security as a reference for cooperating in the implementation of food crops and livestock development efforts to ensure the achievement of national food production, by applying the principles of good forestry governance. Development of food crops and livestock in forest areas, can be done by the following mechanism: a) changes in the allocation of forest areas through the release of forest areas or exchange of forest areas; b) the use of forest area in forest area through borrowing of forest area; and c) forest utilization. The development of food crops and livestock in forest areas can be done through co-operation mechanisms. Further provisions on the development of food crops and livestock in the forest area as referred to in paragraph (1) shall be regulated in separate Ministerial Regulations.

Policy_Content: This Act adds a new Chapter to the Liberian Code to create the Liberian Land Authority. The Authority shall be a body corporate and shall be governed by a Commission. The primary mandate of the Authority is to develop policies on a continuous basis, undertake actions and implement programs for land governance. The Authority shall, among other things, hold and manage all public and unallocated lands in Liberia, make a land inventory, sell or otherwise alienate public land, allocate land for conservation purposes (protected areas), promote development of land use plans, adjudicate land disputes, regulate land mapping and survey, and administer land registration systems. There shall also be a National Consultative Forum to discuss affairs of the Authority. The Authority shall have departments, each governed by a Commissioner. The Act also provides for the establishment of county land governance structures and Community Land Management and Development Associations.

Policy: Public Private Partnership (PPP) Law, 2016.
Policy_Content: This Law provides with respect to Public-Private Partnerships (PPP) in Afghanistan. It requires the government to support, encourage and ensure the impunity of investment of private sectors in the PPP projects. Unless otherwise prohibited by the law, the Government may conclude investment contracts in Public-Private Partnership projects in specified sectors including, amongst others energy generation, agriculture, irrigation, and the environment. This Law shall apply to entities involved in (large) financing projects through Public-Private Partnership. The Ministry of Finance shall prepare a separate procedure for projects where the anticipated investment value is below a minimum amount established by the High Economic Council at the recommendation of the Minister of Finance. Where the rules and regulations of international Organizations and donor agencies are in conflict with the provisions of this law, the government may approve the rules and regulations of such organizations for a PPP project; provided that the approval is prompted by interests and wellbeing of the public.

Policy: Council Decision (EU) 2016/1841 on the conclusion, on behalf of the European Union, of the Paris Agreement adopted under the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change.
Policy_Content: By virtue of this Decision, the Council of the European Union approves the Paris Agreement adopted on 12 December 2015 under the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change. The Agreement aims to strengthen the global response to the threat of climate change, in the context of sustainable development and efforts to eradicate poverty, by: (a) holding the increase in the global average temperature to well below 2 °C above pre-industrial levels and pursuing efforts to limit the temperature increase to 1,5 °C above pre-industrial levels; (b) Increasing the ability to adapt to the adverse impacts of climate change and foster climate resilience and low greenhouse gas emissions development, in a manner that does not threaten food production; and (c) making finance flows consistent with a pathway towards low greenhouse gas emissions and climate-resilient development. The text of the Agreement is attached in the Annex.

Policy: Law No. 1.109 establishing the State Policy to Encourage the Generation and Use of Solar, Wind and Biomass Energy.
Policy_Content: This Law, consisting of 14 articles, establishes the State Policy to Encourage the Generation and Use of Solar, Wind and Biomass Energy. The objectives of the State Policy are: stimulate, as a way of reducing the consumption of the different energy sources, the investments and the implantation of solar energy systems, encompassing the development technology and the production of photo-voltaic, photo-thermal, wind and biomass solar energy for self consumption in private and public, residential, community, commercial and industrial projects; and create alternative employment and income. It is incumbent upon the State, through the competent bodies: to support the implementation and development of projects that contemplate as a source of energy the use of solar, wind and biomass energy equipment; support the implementation of photo-voltaic, photo-thermal, wind and biomass solar energy production systems for consumption; stimulate agricultural activities that use alternative energy sources, contributing to the preservation of the environment; stimulate partnerships between municipal, state and federal public agencies with the objective of technologically endowing the enterprises benefited by the policy dealt with in this law, increasing economics, productivity and technological efficiency; create mechanisms to facilitate the promotion of the manufacture, use and marketing of products inherent to the solar, wind and biomass energy system.

Policy: Law No. HO-165-N Tax Code.
Policy_Content: Tax Code regulates applicable taxes in the Republic of Armenia, mandatory payments defined in the Code, principles of tax system, concepts of tax payment, types, range of taxpayers, tax rates, tax calculation, payment, and in cases defined by the Code, the procedure and terms of collection of dues, as well as tax benefits. State taxes shall include environmental tax. Local taxes shall include real estate (land) tax. Mandatory payments (dues) shall include environmental fees. Profit tax payers engaged in the production of agricultural products are exempted from payment on income from the sale of agricultural products, as well as from the sale of other assets in terms of other income received, if the share of other income from the sale of other assets does not exceed ten percent of the gross income of the respective tax year. Environmental tax shall be paid to the state budget for release of hazardous substance to the atmosphere from stationary sources and mobile sources and waste generators and use of natural resources (wild flora and fauna species, timber, surface water, groundwater, minerals). Real estate tax is a local tax, which does not depend on economic activities of taxpayers, to be paid to local budgets. In defined cases real estate tax is paid for permanent tenancy of public land. The object of taxation by the real estate tax is the real estate, the land plots and (or) their improvements. Real estate tax is calculated at the following annual rates: (a) for real estate of agricultural significance - 15%; and (b) for real estate of non-agricultural land – 1%. Real estate shall be subject to cadastral assessment procedure for taxation purposes. This Law consists of 22 Sections divided into LXXXII Chapters. Section 1: Concepts and tax system. Chapter I: General provisions. Chapter II: Concepts. Chapter III: System of taxes and payments. Section 2: Taxpayers (tax agents) and tax agencies. Chapter IV: Organizations and individuals. Chapter V: Participants of joint activity. Chapter VI: Duties and rights of taxpayers (tax agents) and their officials. Chapter VII: Duties and competencies of tax agency (tax supervising official). Section 3: Tax liabilities, accountability system and calculation documents. Chapter VIII: Tax liability and realization thereof. Chapter IX: Tax calculations. Chapter X: Calculation documents. Chapters XI-LIV (Sections 4-12) introduce the essence of value added tax, excise tax, profit tax, income tax, environmental tax, road tax, nature utilization fee, real estate tax, vehicle tax, turnover tax and tax payers, also the objects subjected to these types of taxation, the privileges, the calculation, the bases of taxation and rates, the procedure of payment, return and joint account entry of amounts of these types of taxes. Section 13: Special systems of taxation. Chapter LV: Turnover tax system. Chapter LVI: Family entrepreneurship system. Chapter LVII: Patent tax. Section 14: Registration of taxpayers. Chapter LVIII: System of registration of taxpayers. Chapter LIX: Registration of value added taxpayers. Chapter LX: Registration of taxpayers in case of re-organization and change of tax agency of registration of taxpayer. Chapter LXI: Termination of activity of taxpayer and removal from register. Section 15, Chapter LXII: Tax payer service. Chapter LXIII: Functions of tax payer notification. Chapter LXIV: Functions of accepting and providing tax calculation and other documents. Chapter LXV: Horizontal monitoring system. Section 16, Chapter LXVI: Calculation of tax liabilities and debit money. Section 17 (Chapters LXVII-LXXV) introduces tax supervision, studies, assessment of indirect tax bases and liabilities and parallel procedures of supervision; as well as regulations for transfer price formation; application of cash registers; usage if excise stamps. Section 18 (Chapters LXXVI-LXXVII) deals with the liability for violation or not-adherence of the requirements of this Code. Section 19 (Chapters LXXVIII-LXXIX) establishes the provision of realization of tax liabilities. Section 20 (Chapter LXXX) introduces the procedure of appellation of activities or inactivity of tax agent. Sections 21, 22 (Chapters LXXXI-LXXXII) conclude the Code with final and transitional provisions, which establish, inter alia, that certain paragraphs of articles 64, 109, 123, 104, 105, 125, 132, 150, 159, 238, 348, 396 enter into force on 1 January 2017.

Policy: Regional Law No. 132-ZSO “On food security”.

Policy: Resolution No. 105 of the Forest Agency validating the Regulation on main use felling and intermediate felling in forest.
Policy_Content: This Resolution shall be applicable to all forests growing on the national territory irrespectively of the form of ownership thereof. The procedure for main use and intermediate logging in forests depends on vegetation conditions, species composition and forest protection category. Main use felling shall be performed in forests grown for the purpose of obtaining industrial wood. Intermediate logging is a type of logging that is performed in forests, with a view of setting conditions for the growth of forest species and the improvement of forests. Sanitary cutting is performed in order to improve the sanitary condition of forests. Felling associated with the reconstruction of low-value forest plantations is performed in order to replace available forest stand with more productive with higher environmental value. In forests of national parks and historical and cultural parks, nature monuments of scientific value, green forest belts, walnut forests of industrial value, juniper forests and coastal forests shall be authorized only sanitary (species improvement) felling by permit issued by authorized state body in the sphere of forest management. Selection of forest species for all types of felling shall be calculated either by number of trees or by the amount expressed in cubic meters.

Policy: Loi n° 2016-71 du 30 septembre 2016, portant loi de l’investissement.
Policy_Content: La présente loi a pour objectif la promotion de l’investissement et l’encouragement de la création d’entreprises et de leur développement selon les priorités de l’économie nationale, notamment à travers : l’augmentation de la valeur ajoutée, de la compétitivité et de la capacité d’exportation de l’économie nationale et de son contenu technologique aux niveaux régional et international, ainsi que le développement des secteurs prioritaires, la création d’emplois et la promotion de la compétence des ressources humaines, la réalisation d’un développement régional intégré et équilibré, la réalisation d’un développement durable. Elle fixe le régime juridique de l’investissement réalisé par des personnes physiques ou morales, résidentes ou non résidentes, dans toutes les activités économiques classées conformément à « la nomenclature d’activités tunisienne », adoptée uniformément par tous les services publics intervenant dans l’investissement. La nomenclature d’activités tunisienne est fixée par décret gouvernemental.

Policy: Forest Research Institute Malaysia Act 2016 (Act 782).
Policy_Content: This Act is enacted to provide for the continued existence of the Forest Research Institute of Malaysia  and the dissolution of the Malaysian Forestry Research and Development Board. The Act   sets out the administration, functions and powers of the Forest Research Institute Malaysia. The functions of the Institute shall include: (a) to implement policies on research and development programmes to ensure the growth and sustainability of the forest and forest-based industries; (b) to conduct and promote research on the multiple roles and functions of forests; (c) to conduct and promote research on forest development including the production, extraction, processing, storage, transportation and utilization of forest produce; etc.

Policy: Ley XVI Nº 120 - Creación del Instituto Forestal Provincial (INFOPRO).
Policy_Content: Por medio de la presente Ley se crea el Instituto Forestal Provincial (INFOPRO), que actuará como un órgano de participación, deliberación y definición de políticas forestales de la Provincia de Misiones. Sus principales objetivos son promover, fomentar y fortalecer el desarrollo de la producción, elaboración, industrialización, comercialización y consumo de productos forestales derivados de la utilización racional de la madera, procurando la sustentabilidad de los diferentes sectores involucrados. Los programas que desarrolle el Instituto deben contribuir a facilitar acciones tendientes a mejorar la competitividad de los distintos sectores y ampliar los mercados.

Policy: Ley XVI Nº 119 - Creación del Plan Maestro Forestal en la Provincia de Misiones.
Policy_Content: En virtud de esta Ley se crea en la Provincia de Misiones el Plan Maestro Forestal, cuya visión es contribuir al desarrollo foresto-industrial sustentable de la región. Entre sus principales objetivos se contempla promover: 1) la inclusión de más misioneros en el desarrollo socioeconómico sustentable; 2) el incremento sostenido del valor de la riqueza foresto-industrial basado en el reconocimiento social de sus bienes y servicios; 3) el manejo sustentable y la competitividad de las plantaciones forestales, que se orientarán a la obtención de bienes maderables y generación de servicios ambientales, sean sistemas de plantaciones en macizo o en pisos productivos, tal como los sistemas agroforestales o silvopastoriles; 4) el uso óptimo total sustentable de la biomasa forestal de bosques cultivados y foresto-industria; 5) el incremento de la calidad de los productos en la producción primaria y su primera transformación, diversificando la base productiva; 6) el incremento cualitativo y cuantitativo del empleo forestal; 7) el acceso con competitividad a las cadenas productivas y los mercados de las empresas foresto-industriales.
Subject: Forestry

El FUT buscará la disminución del número, la simplificación y el mejoramiento de la calidad de los reportes de datos oficiales básicos que deban presentar las entidades obligadas a informar. Para el efecto, el FUT contribuirá a la automatización de procesos y, para su operación y funcionamiento, se apoyará en las tecnologías de la información y las comunicaciones.

Policy: Acuerdo Nº 1422 - Política Nacional de Salud 2015-2019.
Policy_Content: El presente Acuerdo tiene por objeto aprobar la Política Nacional de Salud, un instrumento intersectorial de alcance nacional, relativo al período 2015-2019, cuyo objetivo general es garantizar el derecho a la salud de todas las personas mediante un Sistema Nacional de Salud integrado, sólido, que fortalezca sostenidamente lo público y regule efectivamente lo privado, con un abordaje de determinación social de la salud, sumando esfuerzos hacia la cobertura universal de salud, el acceso universal a la salud, búsqueda constante de la equidad y de un ambiente sano y seguro, a través de la promoción de la salud, prevención de la enfermedad, curación y rehabilitación. La política se sustenta en los principios del proceso de reforma: transparencia, solidaridad, compromiso social, equidad, universalidad, gratuidad, intersectorialidad, participación social y organización comunitaria. Al fin de desarrollar y profundizar la Reforma de Salud, la política establece los siguientes diez ejes estratégicos: 1) Redes Integradas e Integrales de Salud, 2) Sistema de Emergencias Médicas, 3) Medicamentos y otras Tecnologías Sanitarias, 4) Intersectorialidad e Intrasectorialidad, 5) Foro Nacional de Salud, 6) Instituto Nacional de Salud, 7) Información Estratégica en Salud, 8) Desarrollo de Talento Humano en Salud, 9) Violencia, 10) Salud y Salud Ambiental.

Policy: Decision No. 2848/145689 defining the framework for the implementation of Measure 11 "Organic Farming" of the Rural Development Programme (RDA) 2014-2020.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Decision, consisting of 21 articles and three Annexes, is to establish the institutional framework for the implementation, management and monitoring of Measure 11 on "Organic Farming" of the 2014-2020 Rural Development Programme (RDP). Financial support under the Measure is provided for beneficiaries to be compensated for loss and income foregone, additional costs and transaction costs that, as the case may be, involve the conversion or maintenance of organic farming practices, in accordance with the principles and methods of organic farming as defined in Council Regulation (EC) 834/2007. The competent authority of this measure is the Special Management Service of the Rural Development Programme 2014-2020 (ESA RDP), which also has the responsibility for the overall management and implementation of the Rural Development Programme 2014-2020, as provided for in Law No. 4314/2014. The Management Intermediate Body of the Measure is defined as the Directorate of Organic Production and Geographical Indication Systems of the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development, with the administrative assistance of the Organization of Control of Community Aid for Guidance and Guarantee (OPEKEPE).

Policy: Décret présidentiel n° 16-253 du 25 Dhou El Hidja 1437 correspondant au 27 septembre 2016 portant ratification de la convention régionale sur les règles d’origine préférentielles Pan Euro-méditerranéennes, signée à Bruxelles, le 5 octobre 2012.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret ratifie la convention régionale sur les règles d’origine préférentielles Pan Euro-méditerranéennes, signée à Bruxelles, le 5 octobre 2012. Ce texte recueille les règles permettant de déterminer l’origine des marchandises échangées dans le cadre des accords de libre-échange dans la zone euro-méditerranéenne, pour pouvoir leur appliquer des préférences tarifaires, des réductions ou des suppressions de droits de douane et de taxes d’effet équivalent. Cette décision doit permettre de surmonter les difficultés liées à la gestion de l’actuel réseau d’une soixantaine de protocoles bilatéraux sur les règles d’origine avec les pays ou territoires de la région euro-méditerranéenne. Outre les 27 Etats membres de l’Union, les parties contractantes à la Convention sont les îles Féroé, les pays de l’AELE (Islande, Norvège, Suisse et Liechtenstein), les pays signataires de la déclaration de Barcelone (Algérie, Egypte, Israël, Jordanie, Liban, Maroc, Syrie, Tunisie, Organisation de Libération de la Palestine) ainsi que les pays des Balkans occidentaux (Croatie, Serbie, Bosnie-Herzégovine, Monténégro, ARYM et Albanie).

Policy: Décret n° 2016-261 du 26 septembre 2016 portant ratification de la convention internationale sur la protection des droits de tous les travailleurs migrants et les membres de leur famille.
Policy_Content: Le présent décret ratifie la convention internationale sur la protection des droits de tous les travailleurs migrants et les membres de leur famille. Le but de la Convention est de protéger les travailleurs migrants et les membres de leur famille en améliorant le respect des droits de l'homme. De par son existence, elle constitue un standard moral, servant de guide pour la promotion des droits des travailleurs migrants dans tous les pays. La Convention des Nations unies constitue un important traité international dans le domaine de la protection des droits des travailleurs migrants. Elle souligne le lien entre les migrations et les droits de l’homme, thème prenant une importance politique capitale dans le monde entier.  La convention s'applique à tous les travailleurs migrants et aux membres de leur famille sans distinction aucune ainsi qu'à tout le processus de migration, des préparatifs au retour dans l'Etat d'origine. Sont définis les travailleurs migrants: travailleurs frontaliers, travailleurs saisonniers, gens de mer, travailleurs d'une installation en mer, travailleurs itinérants, travailleurs employés au titre de projet, travailleurs admis pour un emploi spécifique, travailleurs indépendants.  Elle énonce les mesures que les Etats parties doivent prendre afin que les migrations interviennent en toute légalité. Le 1er juillet 2003, la Convention internationale sur la protection des droits de tous les travailleurs migrants et des membres de leur famille est entrée en vigueur, après atteinte du seuil de vingt ratifications en mars 2003.

The Authority shall be responsible for, among other things - ensuring sustainable and secure supplies in the regulated sector; setting and maintaining service standards; protecting and preserving the environment; ensuring that the regulation of the energy sector is done in accordance with the best international regulatory practice. El artículo 3º enumera los principios que rigen dicha intervención, entre los cuales se contemplan el principio de responsabilidad provincial, transversalidad del cambio climático, compromiso intergeneracional y desarrollo sostenible. La Provincia de Río Negro impulsará acciones tendientes a, entre otros aspectos: 1) impulsar el ahorro y la eficiencia energética y la potenciación del uso de energías renovables y alternativas; 2) dar protección a los recursos naturales, en especial aquéllos que tienen una función de sumidero; 3) promover el mantenimiento de las zonas forestadas, la forestación y la reforestación. Se prevé la adopción del Plan Provincial de Acción frente al Cambio Climático y se establece el Comité Asesor frente al Cambio Climático.

Policy: Regulation of Agriculture Mechanized Services
Policy_Content: The Regulation sets provisions to improve agriculture mechanized services and training on how to use agricultural machineries and to introduce agrotechnical standards.   The Regulation consists of 11 articles, divided into 3 Chapters: General Provisions (I); Duties (II); Miscellaneous Provisions (III).  The main objectives of this Regulation include: to increase the quality and quantity of agricultural products through use of new technologies; to improve the capability of cooperatives and farmers to use agricultural mechanized services; to set agrotechnical standards for use of agricultural machineries; to promote better methods for use of agricultural machineries to increase cultivation per unit of land; to achieve agricultural development. The Ministry of Agriculture, Irrigation, and Livestock is the authority responsible to implement the objectives of this Regulation and to allocate the necessary budget. In each province of the country, agricultural mechanized stations, by providing agricultural mechanized services, assists farmers in various stages, such as preparing the agricultural land, cultivation, harvest, process of agricultural products, and soil improvement.

Policy: Ley para la Mitigación y Adaptación ante los Efectos del Cambio Climático para el Estado de Colima.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley regula la concurrencia del Gobierno del Estado y de los Ayuntamientos en la formulación e instrumentación de las políticas públicas para la adaptación al cambio climático y la mitigación de sus efectos adversos, con el objetivo de proteger a la población y coadyuvar al desarrollo sustentable. Entre sus objetivos específicos, la Ley busca: promover las acciones de adaptación y mitigación al fenómeno de cambio climático derivadas del trabajo y coordinación entre sociedad y gobierno; cuidar, proteger, fomentar y aprovechar racionalmente los recursos naturales, bajo el esquema de sustentabilidad; promover la cultura ambiental ante la sociedad y el sector productivo en la entidad; asegurar que las acciones de adaptación y mitigación al cambio climático coadyuven al desarrollo económico y mejoren la calidad de vida de los colimenses.

Policy: Biodiversity Conservation Act 2016.
Policy_Content: The purpose of this Act, consisting of 319 sections divided into seventeen Parts and completed by one Schedule, is to conserve and protect biodiversity and biodiversity components in the State; and to promote the ecologically sustainable use of biodiversity components in the State. In the pursuit of the objects of this Act, regard must be had to the principles of ecologically sustainable development as follows: a) decision making processes should effectively integrate both long term and short term economic, environmental, social and equitable considerations; b) if there are threats of serious or irreversible environmental damage, lack of full scientific certainty should not be used as a reason for postponing measures to prevent environmental degradation; c) the present generation should ensure that the health, diversity and productivity of the environment is maintained or enhanced for the benefit of future generations; d) the conservation of biodiversity and ecological integrity should be a fundamental consideration in decision making; e) improved valuation, pricing and incentive mechanisms should be promoted.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 379-pp validating the Regulation on state nature biological reserve of regional significance “Solvychegodsky”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes that state nature reserve of regional significance “Solvychegodsky” shall be constituted with a view of conservation and reproduction of wild fauna species (game), and it is importance within ecological system as biological reserve and resting ground for wild fauna species. The proclamation of the territory reserve shall not entail expropriation of land plots from tenants and owners. Owners and tenants of land plots located within the boundaries of the reserve are obliged to observe the special protection regime established in the nature reserve. On the territory of nature reserve shall be prohibited any activity contrasting the scope of nature reserve or damaging natural complexes and components, including: (a) felling of forest species (except for felling for forest fire extinguishment, sanitary felling and felling related to removal dead, fallen and damaged forest stand); (b) construction of buildings, facilities, roads and pipelines, power lines and other communications, with the exception of facilities ensuring operation of the reserve; (c) waste disposal; (d) capture and hunting of wild fauna species that are not subject to hunting; (e) hunting, except for the purpose of regulation of the number of game; (f) destruction and damaging mating and nesting grounds of wild fauna species, collection of eggs; (g) application of toxic chemicals, mineral fertilizers, plant protection means and nutrients; (h) geological exploration of subsoil and mining; (i) organization of tourist camps and making fires outside specially equipped areas; (j) entry, exit and parking of motor vehicles, except for service vehicles; and (k) destruction or damaging warning signs and information boards.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 383-pp validating the Regulation on state nature biological reserve of regional significance “Soyansky”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes that state nature reserve of regional significance "Soyansky" shall be constituted with a view of conservation lake-river system of the Soyan River, to reproduce and restore the number of wild fauna species, rare and endangered species wild fauna and wild flora species, precious fish species, their habitats and the general ecological balance of the protected area, also in the process of the reserve territory management. Functional protection regime of nature reserve shall be differentiated in economic activities area and area of restricted nature management. The following activities shall be prohibited within economic activities area: (a) capture of wild fauna species that are not subject to hunting; (b) hunting, except for the purpose of regulation of the number of game; (c) destruction of nesting grounds and mating grounds of wild fauna species; collection of eggs; (d) felling of forest species, except for sanitary felling, felling for forest fires extinguishing; (e) entry, exit and parking of motor vehicles, except for service vehicles; (f) navigation on motor floating facilities along spawning grounds of the rivers, except for small-size service vessels; (g) waste disposal; (h) organization of tourist camps and making fires outside specially equipped areas; (i) release of alien species; (j) land reclamation and swamp drying; (k) application of chemicals, mineral fertilizers, plant protection means and nutrients; and (l) destruction or damaging warning signs and information boards. In the area of restricted nature management shall be prohibited the following activities: (a) entry, exit and parking of motor vehicles, except for service vehicles; (b) ploughing up and grazing of cattle; and (c) construction, except for construction of the facilities required for the functioning of the nature reserve.

Policy: Regional Decree No. 382-pp validating the Regulation on state nature landscape reserve of regional significance “Ust-Chetlas”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes that state nature landscape reserve of regional significance “Ust-Chetlas” is constituted with a view of conservation of a typical sample of the Chetlas Stone (Middle Timan) landscape, plant protection included in the Red Book of the Russian Federation and the Red Book of the Arkhangelsk Region, maintaining a common ecological balance. The proclamation of the territory reserve shall not entail expropriation of land plots from tenants and owners. All users, owners and owners of land plots are obliged to observe the regime established in the reserve. On the territory of nature reserve shall be prohibited any activity contrasting the scope of nature reserve or damaging natural complexes and components, including: (a) felling of forest species (except for felling for forest fire extinguishment, sanitary felling and felling related to removal dead, fallen and damaged forest stand); (b) construction of buildings, facilities, roads and pipelines, power lines and other communications, with the exception of facilities ensuring operation of the reserve; (c) ) capture of wild fauna species that are not subject to hunting; (d) hunting, except for the purpose of regulation of the number of game; (e) destruction of nesting grounds and mating grounds of wild fauna species; collection of eggs; (f) application of toxic chemicals, mineral fertilizers, plant protection means and nutrients; (g) release of alien species; (h) entry, exit and parking of motor vehicles, except for service vehicles; (i) waste disposal; (j) exploration of subsoil and mining; (k) organization of tourist camps and making fires outside specially equipped areas; and (l) destruction or damaging warning signs and information boards.
Subject: Environment gen., Wild species & ecosystems
Geographical_area: Arctic, ASIA AND THE PACIFIC, Black Sea, Caspian Sea, CIS (Commonwealth of Independent States), Eastern Europe, Europe, EUROPE AND CENTRAL ASIA, North Pacific, North-West Pacific

Policy: Regional Decree No. 384-pp validating the Regulation on state nature biological reserve of regional significance “Shultussky”.
Policy_Content: This Regional Decree establishes that state nature reserve of regional significance “Shultussky” shall be constituted with a view of conservation, reproduction and restoration the number of wild fauna species, natural habitats thereof and maintenance of the overall ecological balance. The proclamation of the territory reserve shall not entail expropriation of land plots from tenants and owners. Owners and tenants of land plots located within the boundaries of the reserve are obliged to observe the special protection regime established in the nature reserve. On the whole territory of nature reserve shall be prohibited any activity contrasting the scope of nature reserve or damaging natural complexes and components, including: (a) entry, exit and parking of motor vehicles, except for service vehicles; (b) felling of forest species (except for felling for forest fire extinguishment, sanitary felling and felling related to removal dead, fallen and damaged forest stand); (c) hunting, except for the purpose of regulation of the number of game; (d) capture and hunting of wild fauna species that are not subject to hunting; (e) destruction and damaging mating and nesting grounds of wild fauna species, collection of eggs; (f) stay with unleashed dogs of all breeds; (g) construction of buildings, facilities, roads and pipelines, power lines and other communications, with the exception of facilities ensuring operation of the reserve; (h) application of toxic chemicals, mineral fertilizers, plant protection means and nutrients; (i) release of alien species; (j) waste disposal; (k) exploration of subsoil and mining; (l) organization of tourist camps and making fires outside specially equipped areas; (m) destruction or damaging warning signs and information boards; and (n) burning of vegetation.

Policy: Law No. 1532-VIII amending some legislative acts related to minimum period of lease of agricultural land on which is in course drainage and land reclamation.
Policy_Content: Land Code (No. 2768-III of 2001) shall be amended to add the following wording: “Period of lease of agricultural land plots of drained land or with drainage and land reclamation works in course, destined for agricultural production, and smallholding, shall not be less than 10 years”. Law No.161-XIV “On lease of land” shall be amended to add the following wording: “In case of allotment on lease of plots of drained land or with drainage and land reclamation works in course destined for commercial agricultural production, farming and smallholding, the period of lease contract shall not be less than 10 years. The land lease contract must include tenant's obligation to invest in the development and modernization of appropriate reclamation systems and engineering infrastructure facilities and to promote their proper exploitation”.

Policy: Décret n°2016-0728/P-RM du 20 septembre 2016 portant approbation du Programme National de Sauvegarde du Fleuve Niger (PNS-FN).
Policy_Content: Le présent décret approuve et rend exécutoire, pour une durée de vingt (20) ans allant de 2018 à 2037, le Schéma d’Aménagement et de Développement durable du Delta intérieur du Niger. Ce Schéma est opposable à toutes les collectivités publiques et aux tiers opérant dans son périmètre. Sa mise en œuvre s’organise à travers sa traduction en Schémas Directeurs d’Urbanisme et en plans, programmes et projets de développement. Ces Schémas Directeurs d’Urbanisme, plans, programmes et projets de développement ne peuvent modifier les grandes orientations du Schéma d’Aménagement et de Développement durable du Delta intérieur du Niger. Le Schéma d’Aménagement et de Développement durable du Delta intérieur du Niger, ainsi approuvé, est révisable tous les cinq (05) ans, selon les exigences du développement économique et social du Delta intérieur du Niger.

Policy: Decreto Nº 44-2016 - Código de Migración.
Policy_Content: La presente Ley constituye el Código de Migración de Guatemala, consagrando y regulando el derecho de toda persona a emigrar o inmigrar. El Código contiene 246 artículos divididos en los siguientes libros: I. Derechos en general; II. Sistemas y políticas migratorias; III. Disposiciones finales, transitorias y derogatorias. La Ley crea el Sistema Migratorio Guatemalteco, como el conjunto de instituciones estatales que velan por el migrante y la regulación apropiada y efectiva del ingreso y salida de guatemaltecos y extranjeros al territorio de Guatemala y e! tránsito y la estancia de los extranjeros en el mismo. Asimismo, se crea la Autoridad Migratoria Nacional, la cual tiene a su cargo la formulación, creación y supervisión de la Política Migratoria y de la seguridad en materia de migración. Por último, se crea el Instituto Guatemalteco de Migración, que tendrá competencia exclusiva para la ejecución de la Polltica Migratoria, la administración directa e indirecta de las disposiciones estatales orientadas a la gestión del derecho a migrar, la ejecución presupuestaria aprobada para el efecto y las demás disposiciones que sean consideradas dentro de la legislación nacional del pals.

Policy: Environmental Protection and Management Order, 2016.
Policy_Content: This Order, consisting of 41 sections divided into eight Parts and completed by two Schedules, establishes the Environmental Protection and Management requirements. This Order shall apply to the territory of Brunei Darussalam and establishes that it shall be the duty of every person: (a) to take, so far as is reasonably practicable, such measures to ensure the protection and management of the environment and the prevention, reduction, or control of any potential hazard that may cause pollution or damage to the environment; and (b) to comply with the requirements of this Order, which is divided as follows: Preliminary (Part I); Administration including Authority and Delegation of Powers (Part II); General Duty of person and Prescribed Activities including Environmental Officer (Part III); Powers (Part IV); Investigation of Environmental Incidents (Part V); Offences and Penalties (Part VI); Codes of Practice (Part VII); General (Part VIII). Schedules deal with: Prescribed Activities and Details in Written Notification of Prescribed Activities.
Subject: Environment gen.

Policy: Resolución Nº E 331/2016 - Aprueba estructura organizativa de segundo nivel operativo de la Secretaría de Política Ambiental, Cambio Climático y Desarrollo Sustentable.
Policy_Content: Esta Resolución tiene por objeto aprobar la estructura organizativa de segundo nivel operativo de la Secretaría de Política Ambiental, Cambio Climático y Desarrollo Sustentable. Con respecto a la Dirección de Mitigación del Cambio Climático, ésta tendrà por objeto implementar, entre otras, las siguientes acciones: propiciar el desarrollo, la adopción e implementación de estrategias, planes sectoriales, medidas y políticas de mitigación del cambio climático; elaborar los inventarios de Gases de Efecto Invernadero (GEI), las comunicaciones nacionales, los informes bienales, las contribuciones nacionales y otros proyectos que apoyen los compromisos y metas resultantes de la Convención Marco de las Naciones Unidas sobre el Cambio Climático en materia de mitigación; participar en las negociaciones internacionales sobre Cambio Climático en todas las plataformas internacionales de tratamiento de la temática; propiciar el avance de medidas de mitigación en las áreas de gobierno pertinentes; desarrollar proyectos de mitigación del Cambio Climático. Por otro lado, la Dirección de Adaptación al Cambio Climático se encargará de: propiciar el desarrollo, la adopción e implementación de estrategias, planes sectoriales, medidas y políticas de adaptación al cambio climático y prevención de riesgos de desastres; desarrollar proyectos de adaptación al cambio climático y prevención de riesgos de desastres. Asimismo, se definen las acciones a cargo de la Dirección de Producción y Consumo Sustentable y de la Dirección de Impacto Ambiental y Social.

Policy: Geothermal Resources Development Proclamation No. 981/2016.
Policy_Content: This Proclamation regulates geothermal resources development activities within the territory of the Federal Democratic Republic of Ethiopia. The objectives of the Proclamation include, among other things, ensuring that the country’s geothermal resources are developed  in an orderly, sustainable and environmentally responsible manner,  promoting the use of Grade II geothermal resources for various uses and  encouraging a sustainable, carbon-neutral economy in Ethiopia. The Proclamation distinguishes between Grade I geothermal resources (capable to generate electric power and to provide services such as direct heating and combined heat and power) and Grade II geothermal resources (used for the purposes such as direct heating, agricultural and industrial applications and recreational bathing and medicinal purposes). The competent body may decide that other natural resources in the geothermal resource license area may be developed, in so far as feasible and in a manner consistent with this Proclamation and under the laws applicable to them. No land which is within areas  reserved for natural habitats or national parks may be used for geothermal operations and no operations may take place within 500 metres of a water reservoir or dam. The licensing authority shall establish and maintain a register of geothermal resources. A licence holder may use water from any water body, situated on, under, or flowing through, such land or drill a well required for his activities, subject to the relevant Water Laws, relevant basin plans and upholding best practices and applicable health and safety regulations and directives. Geothermal operations shall be carried out in such a manner as to prevent unnecessary waste of or damage to geothermal or other energy and mineral resources; to protect and enhance the quality of surface and ground waters, air and other natural resources, including wildlife, soil and vegetation; and preserve cultural resources, including archeological, scenic and recreational resources. Used water shall be disposed consistent with Water Laws and relevant basin plans and related Environmental Laws.
